msItem.author: Aldobrandinus de Tuscanella OP
msItem.title: Scala fidei
msItem.note: unpr.; Little 101, citing the present MS.; T. Käppeli, ‘La tradizione manoscritta delle opere di Aldobrandino da Toscanella’, AFP 8 (1938) 163–92, at pp. 165–72, this copy at p. 165; Stegmüller Bibl. 1105, and suppl.; Zumkeller 335; Schneyer 1. 250–52, nos 350–80, this copy erroneously at p. 239 (Sermones quadragesimales); Kaeppeli 133 (recensio posterior), citing the present MS.; Distelbrink 197; T. Hohmann, ‘Initienregister der Werke Heinrichs von Langenstein’, Traditio 32 (1976) 399–426, at p. 407 (no. 70); Bloomfield 2210; see also Madre 321f. and H. Roßmann, ‘Die Quodlibeta und verschiedene sonstige Schriften des Franz von Meyronnes OFM’, Franziskanische Studien 54 (1972) 1–76, at p. 45, n. 127). Incipits/explicits often different from Schneyer; some sermons recorded in Schneyer omitted, others merged; the text on fol. 15vb not in Schneyer. Ascribed to Thomas Aquinas.

msItem.title: Sermons
msItem.incipit: Qvi sanctus est sanctificetur adhuc. et cetera. Ecce uenio cito et merces mea mecum. et reddere unicuique
msItem.note: Collection of eleven sermons: nine from Bertold of Regensburg, Sermones ad religiosos. The last three sermons (De spiritu sancto) anonymous.

msItem.incipit: Ascendit deus in iubilacione et dominus in uoce tube. [Ps 46:6] Nota quod dominus propter .iiijor. ascendit. primo ut daret spiritum sanctum discipulis. unde expedit uobis
msItem.explicit: Qualem locum amenissimum et securissimum. Bernardus. civitas celestis mansio secura.

msItem.incipit: O quam bonus et suauis domine et spiritus tuus. in omnibus nobis. Sap. xijo. Notandum quod dominus dat triplicem spiritum. unum in utero alium in nativitate alium in baptismo
msItem.explicit: sic uenit ad iudicium. Bernardus. primi et secundi saluari possunt et tamen difficulter. sed tercii et quarti non. Rogemus.

msItem.incipit: Svper seruos et ancillas meas effundam de spiritu meo. Iohel 3 .ijo. Tria tanguntur in uerbis propositis. primo. ydoneitas id est honestas hoc est dignitas recipiencium spiritum suum. ibi. Super seruos
msItem.explicit: inter spiritum divinum et dyabolicum. dyabolicus spiritus repleuit orbem terrarum scilicet odio. mendacio. et cetera.
msItem.finalRubric: Finito libro sit laus et gloria christo.

layoutDesc.layout:
Ruling in ink, two columns of 44–46 lines, (fol. 42va/vb) ruled ad hoc. Ruled space
c.157–64 113–17

handDesc.handNote: Small German textualis by a single hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Unfilled spaces for initials and rubrication
Later added red rubrics at the top centre of fol. 1r and in the lower right-hand margin of fol. 23v, in a hand of s. xiv2 from the Mainz Charterhouse

binding.p: Limp parchment case binding for Abp. Laud, 1637–1639.

origin.origPlace: Germany, possibly at the Mainz Charterhouse, in the early years of its existence (s. xiv2/4).

history.provenance: Mainz, Charterhouse St Michael: late 14th-century ex-libris inscription at the lower margin of fol. 1r
William Laud, 1573–1645: his ex-libris inscription, dated 1638, at the lower margin of fol. 2v.
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian as part of his third donation, dispatched on 28 June 1639.
